page.title: 16Policing in East Leicester.
page.content: {Asfordby St.Police Station}has been in existance since 1899,but was partly a fire-station until 1979. There are 36 P.C's,4 of them women. In 1980 an experiment called{'Community Policing' started. Highfields,an area which experiences a lot of crime,was divided into 8 different beats. Each section has a policeman who patrols the area on foot. He is called the R.B.O. (Regular Beat Officer). His aim is to get to know the area & the people. Sometimes being known can count against the policeman. One policeman, dressed in plain clothes,was trying to atch people stealing milk. However, local children recognised him as he had been to the swimming pool with their school. They alerted the suspects,who ran off.
